title: Secondary – Cycle 1 – Progression of Learning - Music (2010)
subject: Arts Education

document.title: Secondary – Cycle 1 – Progression of Learning - Music (2010)

24B4239D68874588806BA68D0660DFF4.description: Describes aspects of his/her experience related to the appreciation dynamic, especially to the strategies used (e.g. use of different techniques for auditory discrimination)

51D9BCACFCCF40068E98333A3D7606BF.description: Describes important aspects of the appreciation of sound sources, technique and elements of musical language

7201A36D755B441C96FD374002EABAC4.description: Uses subject-specific vocabulary in accordance with the prescribed terminology of the program

7BC88D9A787342C088AC5AEE1EC75526.description: Expresses his/her preferences concerning his/her observations through the application of previously acquired appreciation criteria

5C9F0C99E66748D5B31A4ADFFA335207.description: Discusses his/her musical observations, explaining his/her preferences

B6B874F34B2B447EA1D92162DFA0C4F2.description: Uses subject-specific vocabulary in accordance with the prescribed terminology of the program

6B3DA05FE1C142B280DC15B7C94E86E0.description: Makes connections between the musical elements observed and the meaning perceived (e.g. choice of tempo adapted to the emotion or the desired musical atmosphere)

CD031737FD9C44BC9D20FC3450E857FE.description: Associates the elements of content with what he/she has felt

BEA2671CB9B44527AF79881235B62540.description: Interprets the meaning of the work or production

897670E6B9944733A5C8EE5E766C2096.description: Picks out the similarities and contrasts in certain passages associated with the structural elements of the work (e.g. form, tempo, rhythmic, melodic and harmonic organization)

1EA7D2F868A74B8E8E6746599678AC90.description: Picks out similarities and contrasts with the compositional procedures used in the work (e.g. reproduction of sound, repetition, collage)

7047D8588C414F15A0A5B2DBA09EDEAD.description: Locates the following composition procedures: repetition, question and answer, contrast and reproduction of sound

B5B1FC1351EF4D71819B6BB839C141B5.description: Identifies sound sources and techniques used in the work (e.g. voice, strings, winds, playing techniques)

5938AA9D9C6745549859D072E481879E.description: Locates some of the sound sources used: voice, body, musical instruments, sound-producing objects and information and communications technologies

3D5F3ED763254E91B566879DB390D47B.description: Picks out similarities and contrasts associated with elements of musical language used in the work (e.g. dynamics, duration, pitch)

6C2D6917786547CCB9BD88EC1F5EA1E7.description: Locates some of the following elements: intensity and dynamics, duration, pitch, tone colour and quality of sound

D9D9790C1AB543D5925F2AE6A1DB228B.description: Picks out component elements of the work (e.g. sound sources, elements of musical language, structure)

B9CA1922D26A498EA7B52033F79E1C3B.description: Pays attention to subject-specific elements when listening to other students’ productions and to works of the present and past, from here and elsewhere

FE69267FCD8C48EA980E3DBF3F892A9C.description: Applications of Knowledge: Competency 3 – Appreciates musical works

90E1096278554A83821ED159B78D5CC0.description: Describes aspects of his/her experience related to the performance dynamic, especially to the strategies used (e.g. procedures for decoding musical scores)

FC52DB548C23419D93BA7A28D1213CBA.description: Describes important aspects of the use of sound sources, techniques and elements of musical language

8E0685F0E09F471188E17C0ACCAA4051.description: Uses subject-specific vocabulary in accordance with the prescribed terminology of the program

E573C4140EFF4AE5B2B3FF3A3672765C.description: Responds to sound or visual cues related to the work in ensemble playing (e.g. changes in tempo)

87177B10DE854B58AF0EF7A3A2E8511F.description: Takes into account direction indicating the beat

B26418513A6B428A88EE38DFA2E76708.description: Respects the conventions for group ensemble work

BF211AB2FCF443C393C654FDDB4BAC0B.description: Applies elements related to the expressive character of the piece (e.g. use of the dynamics indicated in the piece)

8F69C78EF03E461082CC719C26721817.description: Repeats the piece taking some expressive elements into account

6AABCB91AC8F45BD90D2EAD5E8C382A1.description: Becomes familiar with the expressive nature of the piece of music

9FAD2F2EE4F7469C977964C216684A14.description: Applies the elements of technique required in musical phrases (e.g. posture, breathing, articulation) taking into account the structure of the work

6DE6E42F48544E288E1C67B116DF193B.description: Integrates the voice techniques related to the characteristics of the piece, such as tone

A0A2B6B03F724C2FBC55219FBF559876.description: Executes musical phrases, taking into account sound source used (e.g. voice, strings, winds, percussion, body percussion, information and communications technologies)

63BC58BDF8C4402781BF68E7C6A2AE7D.description: Uses the voice, body, musical instrument, sound-producing object and information and communications technologies proposed in the piece

E62B0971BD4044CCBE43D8337F724204.description: Decodes elements of structure in a musical work (e.g. form, repeat signs, change of tempo, simple rhythmic units, musical phrase, major and minor chords)

9329122297004315BD4FCC1AFA7E9A3D.description: Locates elements related to the structure of the piece: form, tempo, rhythmic organization and melodic organization

52188C6ED40947078F2352BAECCA40DA.description: Decodes elements of musical language in the proposed work, using reading strategies

1E2F18AE3F6942EC978C148D427D1BC6.description: Locates elements of musical language among the qualities of intensity, dynamics, duration, pitch, tone colour and quality of sound

B1B552928562469B82FAAFEA6E813499.description: Becomes familiar with the musical content of the work

DF6ACB061EAD4693BC75A6B6F60507CB.description: Applications of Knowledge: Competency 2 – Performs musical works

DAB362EBC2824BD98EB1C17144CD25A7.description: Describes aspects of his/her experience related to the creative dynamic, especially to the strategies used (e.g. memorization strategies)

26A399DA026245C98C5462CB22C7ECE9.description: Describes important aspects of the use of sound sources, techniques and elements of musical language

6828F9EA65B94EAD8493A955F147D5F8.description: Uses subject-specific vocabulary in accordance with the prescribed terminology of the program

B985375F3C5A4A72950DA27A2B1D8DD6.description: Tries out elements of structure adapted to his/her creation (e.g. use of a musical form and a tempo)

E52BD64E52324A11BC6BEA56EC344C13.description: Uses elements of melody: musical phrase, series of ascending or descending sounds, series of sounds repeated at a fixed pitch

CBE52EB74F054C20A194E808B0262765.description: Plays short sequences using a specific compositional procedure (e.g. contrast, repetition)

CEC4AB82096C44EDA5A085583FF3EE9F.description: Uses the following composition procedures: repetition, question and answer, contrast, reproduction of sound

FCAFAEED924946429B2A2BF4855F55C5.description: Looks for a variety of tones among the sound sources, making use of his/her memory and playing short improvisations (e.g. using mallets made of wood, metal, felt or other materials)

F14BC5F09CC443A28755E8B09F4E7E63.description: Uses some different sound sources: voice, body, musical instruments, soundproducing objects, recorder and information and communications technologies

69E09EA31030449E96DF9948ABDB2FF8.description: Tries out different elements of musical language in short melodic or rhythmic improvisations

0BB43A68E86146E29DE4E1B96D7ACD51.description: Uses different elements intensity and dynamics, duration, pitch, tone colour and quality of sound

FC8590325E304149982F34BFE6C0053F.description: Uses sound sources, elements of musical language and elements of musical technique

8E7898998C7C411CA5BD15E7DE9DAA92.description: Finds ideas related to the language, rules and tools of music that emerge from the stimulus for creation (e.g. compositional procedures, sound sources, musical language)

7710AC4C38C34E4996534F57BF51AB14.description: Looks for ideas inspired by the stimulus for creation

D277EBE31DFF440C93E97C1974B5681D.description: Uses ideas to create a musical work

5AED0732187E43558B458293F303B4F0.description: Applications of Knowledge: Competency 1 – Creates musical works

DA220E372FE543C3A2C1244E9710AB9D.description: Identifies works from the musical repertoire of Québec and the repertoire of other cultures

E15266B885754D9CA9CD05727C31C87F.description: Names artistic periods (e.g. contemporary, classical, baroque) and styles of works (e.g. popular, chansonnier, blues, jazz)

DC121A0443BE4AA094C32461D0C1E9BB.description: Musical repertoire and cultural references for appreciation

BC86C3936CF64EB193447192BABA8ABA.description: Identifies graphic symbols (personal codes) related to musical language and to the structure of a piece of music

23D54FA71C7D47BAA445AFC8DCECDBED.description: Identifies a personal graphic representation in his/her creations

B7195E5274834D6C93EBF007AED016A5.description: Names the following elements of harmonic organization: tone cluster, cluster, major and minor

07C0CF08B54E461189137523C9677626.description: Identifies elements of melodic organization (e.g. musical phrase, ascending and descending series of sounds, conjunct sounds, disjunct sounds, series of sounds repeated at a fixed pitch, glissando)

1F911AE6D82440B2BD3B08E1D2102309.description: Identifies a musical phrase, a series of ascending sounds, a series of descending sounds and a series of sounds repeated at a fixed pitch

359789FD6E52402F95FF2E2AD5CF104E.description: Identifies different elements of rhythmic organization (e.g. beat, measures, simple rhythmic units)

3868457B0D5F4864A68C4EEAD6A23683.description: Identifies tempi among the following: lento, moderato, allegro, accelerando, rallentando, change of tempo, ad libidum, a tempo, ritenuto

2E8B3FC2BC4447338213DB389956191F.description: Identifies tempi using the traditional code: lento, moderato, allegro, accelerando and rallentando

6686D7CA59B04AA1BC6BB749D7114E9C.description: Identifies repeat signs and musical forms from among the following: individual, AB form, ABA form, canon in two voices, rondo, canon, theme and variations

A6F0DF3AC6604A9783441E2AEF2E7595.description: Identifies qualities of sound and articulation signs (e.g. staccato, legato, accent, sforzando)

BF45031946D84106BD58042D57E5F8BB.description: Differentiates crisp sounds from resonant sounds and coarse sounds from smooth sounds

8CABF9F811B54155A619730DF8B380B7.description: Identifies instruments and the families they belong to, as well as registers of the voice (soprano, alto, tenor, bass)

4DD6D51345E64E579B2EBFCE5DEFCCD7.description: Distinguishes the instruments depending on the repertoire used

E5348F25CFCE4601BB9CFE5CEB513CC7.description: Identifies registers, pitches of the diatonic scale, notes on the staff and ledger lines in different keys, according to the instrument played, as well as accidental signs (sharp, flat, natural) and key signatures

89A7AF3A00384986BA1378037062CA2F.description: Differentiates between low, medium and high registers

6BD1BC9E297E42299EA69E87CF825E5E.description: Identifies symbols for notes, rests, and augmentation signs among the following: whole note, half note, quarter note, quarter rest, two eighth notes, eighth note, sixteenth note, whole rest, half rest, eighth rest, dotted note, dotted rest, tie, fermata

89C17A70E2844D10923C1D6DC59A904B.description: Differentiates among notes and rests, including triplets and whole notes

E173308B5F1A4C6A92F41B9B2EE7CC87.description: Identifies some dynamics among the following: forte, piano, crescendo, decrescendo, pianissimo, fortissimo, mezzo piano, mezzo forte, subito piano

946EBC09A01848139A4DFF8AC6D30AE9.description: Identifies the following dynamics: forte, piano, crescendo, decrescendo

26DD90D88F0B4002864A8675346B7DAC.description: Identifies the graphic symbols related to musical language and to the structure, depending on the instrument

47CF7C43DD954005B6DA0B2D92ABD001.description: Distinguishes symbols related to dynamics, duration (including whole notes and triplets) and pitch (on the staff, according to the musical pieces studied)

BF22D22C92A8498688BD4A0A08F29507.description: Graphic representation using a traditional code or a nontraditional code

E4B3B39120AA43BFA3957A49A4514C2A.description: Identifies elements of instrumental technique (e.g. posture, form, breathing [inhaling/exhaling], sound production, attack, articulation)

177891FC75AF4E06A3C2EF8592D4DB10.description: Differentiates among the following elements of technique: posture, form, means of production and technique

04294532BD99484D92DB6CD2F11CE61E.description: Identifies elements of vocal technique (e.g. breathing, intonation, posture, energy, pronunciation, sound production)

5124FDA324BB4AC9BAC5790B553F8E3D.description: Distinguishes among the elements of technique, including tone

651430817CEC4BAE99E36C6581B313EB.description: Identifies some of the following sound sources: voice, strings, winds, percussion, body percussion, information and communications technologies

F5C12C2C3BAD403DA9F4F25A687B3F49.description: Identifies some percussion instruments and a few other instruments, including the recorder

439340DECC8040C6BE6BA4119B08A5B6.description: Identifies compositional techniques (e.g. question/answer, contrast, reproduction of sound, repetition, collage, ostinato, mirror, augmentation)

6334046F53F84139867F5E5EE7401C31.description: Names the composition procedures, including repetition

08F43567FBE14FB28C772D754C410E5B.description: Identifies sound or visual cues related to group ensemble work (e.g. beginning or ending of a piece, dynamics, beat, changes in tempo)
